1.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to breathe hard, i.e. be enraged
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)

2.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

3.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
a fountain (also collectively), figuratively, a source (of satisfaction)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

4.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

5.brief: play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

6.brief: to gleam, i.e. (figuratively) be cheerful; by transference to sound clear (of various animal or human expressions)
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
